intro: Pimpinella involucrata, commonly known as the clustered cow-wheat, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated edges and small, yellowish-white flowers arranged in umbels. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and is native to parts of Europe and Asia. It has a taproot system and produces small, dry fruits called schizocarps. Pimpinella involucrata is often found in woodlands and along stream banks, where it thrives in rich, loamy soils.
